column4: so i installed the nvidia driver as it explained on ubuntuguide.org, and i hit ctrl-alt-bkspc to restart X, but it didn't restart it, it just killed it
and now when i login and then % sudo gdm, it says it's already running
so how do i get back to X?
do sudo -s (enter your user password)
then what?
then do killall gdm      followed by /etc/init.d/gdm restart
i'll try that, thanks
that worked, thank you
sometimes you need to do a restart x to get things running properly :)
try installing libmp4-0
that's if your runnig Hoary I don't knwo about Warty
i am running hoary.  so just install that and see if it works?  anything else i have to do?
I did apt-cache serach aac and it brought up a few libraries that might help getting it working. >> libfaad2-0 might be one that you need as well, I am just guessing :D
libmp4-0 doesn't seem to be a package that exists, at least in the repos i have
do you have universe enabled ?
i believe i do
it's in the mirillat repositories
ok
add that repo then apt-get update and it outta be there
yeah xorg will read the XF86Config-4 file if it exists
it's called a metapackage, all it does is reference a bunch of files to download as dependencies
you installed Ubuntu ?
no, i don't have it installed yet =P  had it installed before, but wiped so I'd have windows also
